executiveSummary: Neil Desai pitched his app 'KAF' (also called 'Kate') on Shark Tank, seeking $50,000 for 5% equity. The app, initially framed as a tool for cheaters, was debated for its moral implications but ultimately attracted multiple offers. Neil accepted a deal from Kevin O’Leary and Daymond John for $70,000 in exchange for 35% equity.
keyDecisions: Neil Desai accepted an investment offer of $70,000 for 35% equity from Kevin O’Leary and Daymond John.
nextSteps: Neil Desai will proceed with partnership discussions and business development alongside Kevin O’Leary and Daymond John to grow and potentially reposition the app.
